item.description: Research An Equilibrium Model of Wage and Hours Determination: Labor Market Regulation in the Retail Sector A recent push to limit the discretion large retailers have over their employee’s schedules aims to increase predictability but at an unmeasured cost to market efficiency. Understanding the implications such policies have for a labor market where hours vary and employees have limited control over their own scheduling requires a model of why such jobs exist and also why individuals accept them.
